When it Blooms: Early to mid summer (June through July)
Soil Type: Poor to average soil, low water needs, drought resistant
Habit: Height: 24”, Spread: 24”, Clumping, spreads by above ground or shallow rhizomes about 3-6 inches per year
Maturity Rate: Rapid maturity, will flower first year
Something Special or Unique: Blooms 8 weeks or longer

Soil Type: Well draining, drought resistant
Habit: Height: 36, Spread: 12”-24”, Clumping, occasionally reseeds
Maturity Rate: Flowers first year, small first year. Reaches full size second year
Long Lived or Short Lived: Long Lived, seeds collected from zone 4 garden
Something Special or Unique: Pinch back in Late June for more lush plants. Flowers are darker purple during cooler temperatures

Soil Type: Well draining, drought resistant
Habit: Height: 24” (36” with flower stalk), Spread: 12”-24”, Clumping, occasionally reseeds
Maturity Rate: Flowers first year, small first year. Reaches full size second year
Something Special or Unique: Flowers edible, very sweet, leaves edible with hint of licorice, root beer. Does not like wet winter soil, mulch to help winter over, do not trim back until late spring-old wood helps protect crown for the winter

Soil Type: Well draining, moist, but not soggy
Habit: Height: 6” (10” with flower stalk), Spread: 6”-10”, Clumping
Long Lived or Short Lived: Long Lived: Does not tolerate soggy soil in winter
Something Special or Unique: Good cut and dried flower, nice grey soft foliage, host for Painted Lady Butterflies

Where to Grow: Prefers full sun, tolerates partial shade
Soil Type: Better flavor when grown in heavier soil, does best in well draining soil
Habit: Height: 24” (36” with flower stalk), Spread: 12”-24”, Clumping, occasionally reseeds
Something Special or Unique: Host plant for Eastern Swallowtail Butterfly, edible, grown organically, slow to bolt in summer heat

Soil Type: Well draining, moist
When to divide: Do not divide, long tap root, but can collect seeds and refrigerate to vernalize and grow the following year
Habit: Height: 6” (24” with flower stalk), Spread: 6-12”, Clumping, occasionally reseeds
Maturity Rate: Flowers second year. Typically live 3-5 years, might reseed
Something Special or Unique: Good cut flower

Soil Type: Well draining, dry soil, drought resistant
Habit: Height: 4” (6” with flower stalk), Spread: 4-6”, Clumping and spreads very slowly
Maturity Rate: Flowers first year
Something Special or Unique: 2-3 foot tap root, be careful not to accidentally pull out thinking it’s a clump of grass

Soil Type: Rich, moist, well draining
When to divide: Rosettes can be cut off parent in spring
Habit: Height: 24” with flower stalk, Plant: 8” tall, Spread: 8”, Mound
Something Special or Unique: Spectacular shades of purple, to red orange colors in the fall with cold temperatures; one of the first flowers to bloom in spring

Type: Annual (reseeds or collect seeds to use next year)
Soil Type: Well draining, moist
When to divide: Do not divide, long tap root. Soak peat pot until pot it is mushy and bury plant to top of peat pot and water. May flop in sun on first day but will recover the next day
Habit: Height: 6” (24” with flower stalk), Spread: 6-12”, Clumping, occasionally reseeds
Maturity Rate: Flowers second year. Typically live 3-5 years, might reseed
Something Special or Unique: Leaves can be used fresh for tea giving the water a cucumber flavor-add lemon and chill for a replentishing summer drink. Companion plant for the vegetable garden-attracts bees and other beneficial insects. Flowers are sugary sweet and full of nectar especially in the morning.

Soil Type: Well draining, moist, drought resistant after first year
Habit: Height: 24” first year, then 3-6', Spread: 12” first year, then 3-4'. Shrub that dies back during winter
Maturity Rate: Flowers first year. Takes 2-3 years to reach max height
Something Special or Unique: Monarch Magnet! Highly nectar producing. Non-invasive variety. In the North, helps monarch with migration-blooms after eggs are set

Soil Type: Any soil, prefers slightly alkaline, drought resistant
Habit: Height: 18”, Spread: 18”, Clumping, Spreads by reseeding
Maturity Rate: Blooms first year
Something Special or Unique: Nectar producing, mulch around plants to prevent volunteers

Soil Type: Average soil, likes clay
Habit: Height: 24”, Spread: 18”, Clumping
Maturity Rate: Slow, blooms first year
Something Special or Unique: Very difficult to grow from seed. Small first year, spends most of its energy setting roots the first year, but will return next year strong doubling in size, reaching full size in three years

Soil Type: Any soil, drought resistant
When to divide: Early spring when leaves about 4” high
Habit: Height: 12” (24-36” with flower), Spread: 12”, Clumping
Maturity Rate: Small first year, full size second year
Something Special or Unique: Monarchs love these; spent flower stalks create winter interest

Soil Type: Well draining, medium to dry soil, drought resistant second year
Habit: Height: 24” (36” with flower stalk), Spread: 12”-24”, Clumping, occasionally reseeds
Maturity Rate: Small first year, spends first year setting roots
Something Special or Unique: Excellent cut flower, adds texture to the garden, small compact version

Soil Type: Well draining, drought resistant
Habit: Height: 12-24” first year, 36-60” next year
Attracts: Eastern Swallowtail Butterfly and beneficial insects
Maturity Rate: Small first year, doubles in size second year
Something Special or Unique: Dark purplish foliage Host plant for Eastern Swallowtail Butterfly. Edible

Zone: 3-9 (mulch in winter to prevent frost heave)
Soil Type: Well Drained, low fertility, drought resistant
When to divide: Collect seeds for next year store in cool, dark, dry place
Habit: Height: 10”, Spread: 12”, Clumping
Maturity Rate: Flowers first year, may be leggy first year, but dense clump second year
Long Lived or Short Lived: 2-3 years, but a few reseeds each year. Seeds easy to collect
Something Special or Unique: Extensive bloom time 2-3 months

Soil Type: Well draining, drought resistant, does not like wet winter soil
When to divide: Do not divide, long tap root
Habit: Height: 18” (24” with flower stalk), Spread: 12”-24”, Clumping
Maturity Rate: Flowers first year from seed
Something Special or Unique: High nectar producing plant during summer heat

Where to Grow: Full shade outdoors; eastern or western window, does not like direct sunlight
Soil Type: Well draining, low fertility, drought resistant
When to divide: When rosette has at least six leaves. Take a clean scissors and cut from main plant. Do not water for 2 weeks after transplanting to prevent roots from rotting
Habit: Height: 6-8”, Spread: 6”, Clumping forming rosettes
Something Special or Unique: Only likes to be watered about once per month, likes to thoroughly dry out between waterings. Grow roots during the winter, mostly dormant during the summer

Soil Type: Well draining, drought resistant after first year
Habit: Height: 24”-36”, Spread: 12”, Clumping
Something Special or Unique: May wilt in noonday sun, but recovers overnight. Excellent cut flowers and nectar producing

Common Name: Coral Bells, Melting Fire and Newest Mixed Hybrids
Soil Type: Well draining (prevents frost heaving), drought resistant
Habit: Height: 24” (36” with flower stalk), Spread: 12”-24”, Clumping; occasionally reseeds
Maturity Rate: Second year, plants will show true leaf color
Something Special or Unique: Evergreen

Soil Type: Average, well draining, tolerates clay
Habit: Height: 24” (36” with flower stalk), Spread: 6"-12”, Clumping, occasionally reseeds
Maturity Rate: Flowers first year
Something Special or Unique: Native to Midwest and Eastern United States

Soil Type: Dry, well draining
Habit: Height: 24”, Spread: 8”, Clumping
Something Special or Unique: Native to the Northeast US, need air circulation to prevent powdery mildew, good mildew resistance

Soil Type: Well draining, drought resistant
Habit: Height: 24” (36” with flower stalk), Spread: 12”-24”, Clumping, occasionally reseeds
Maturity Rate: Flowers second year
Something Special or Unique: Dark purplish foliage that fades to green as the summer progresses

Soil Type: Well draining, drought resistant
Habit: Height: 12” (24” with flower stalk), Spread: 12”-24”, Clumping
Resists: Deer and rabbits nibble in Spring, but plants recover
Something Special or Unique: Very long blooming, low maintenance, low water requirement second year

Soil Type: Any soil, but must be well draining, does not tolerate soggy winter soil
When to divide: Rosettes can be removed in early spring
Habit: Height: 18”, Spread: 18”, Clumping
Maturity Rate: Blooms first year
Something Special or Unique: Difficult to grow from seed. Will flower late first year, and return strong next year. Remove spent flowers to promote reblooming

Soil Type: Well draining soil, drought resistant, no fertilizer needed, water only when soil is chalky dry
Habit: Height: 4”, Spread: Sprawling
Something Special or Unique: Evergreen, good in containers, rockwalls, creavasses, groundcover, good for draping over edges of pots, rocks or steep hillsides
Image Titles: Sedum forsterianum 'Oracle'; yellow flowers:Sedum sexangulare; yellow flowers:Sedum spurium 'Coccineum'; pink flowers:Sedum spurium 'Summer Glory'; red/dark pink

Soil Type: Dry soil, low fertility, drought resistant
When to divide: Early spring; when rosette has several small roots, cut rosette free with scissors
Habit: Height: 4-6” (18” with flower stalk) Spread: 6-12” Spreading; produces rosettes
Maturity Rate: Flowers second year
Something Special or Unique: Tolerates black walnut trees

Soil Type: Any soil, do not overwater (turns yellow)
When to divide: Prefers not to be divided, easy to make cuttings an soak in water to start new plants
Habit: Height: 6-8”, Spread: 8”, Clumping
Long Lived or Short Lived: Rejuvenate by starting new plants from cuttings, or by lifting plant sprigs and adding leafy compost underneath. Sprigs will grow new roots and rejuvenate plant
Something Special or Unique: Excellent for chicken and beef or vegetable casseroles. Has a citrus aftertaste. Use three to four sprigs per recipe. Can also be used to make tea. Plant grown organically

Soil Type: Any soil
When to divide: Can be transplanted when less than 1 foot tall
Habit: Height: 4-6’, Spread: 12”, Clumping, spreading by rosettes, but after many years
Maturity Rate: Three years until full height, might bloom first year, but definitely second year. Slow to come up in spring, breaks ground early June
Long Lived or Short Lived: Long lived; small first year, spends most of its energy setting roots
Something Special or Unique: Very difficult to grow from seed. Prefers afternoon shade from sun. May sag in full heat of summer, but recovers in the evening. Monarch magnet

Soil Type: Well draining, drought tolerant
Habit: Height: 24”, Spread: 24”, Clumping
Maturity Rate: Second year, plants will show true leaf color
Something Special or Unique: Good mildew resistance, good cut flower. Genus name honors Saint Veronica who reportedly gave a handkerchief to Jesus so he could wipe sweat from his face on the way to Calvary, with some genus plants having markings that resemble the markings on the sacred handkerchief
